messages.content: ComfyUI_Jags_Audiotools offers a collection of amazing audio tools for working with audio and sound files in comfyUI.
What issues are the developers currently working on?
As of the document input, the developers are working on resolving issues with three nodes, specifically the load audio and play audio nodes.
Is it possible to use the audio tools completely offline?
Yes, the user can create a models folder and place the modules there if they want to use it completely offline.
What features are included in ComfyUI_Jags_Audiotools?

ComfyUI_Jags_Audiotools allows the use of trained dance diffusion/sample generator models in comfyUI. It also includes optional extensions like Wave Generator for creating primitive waves, and a wrapper for the Pedalboard library.
To install, drop the '_ComfyUI_Jags_Audiotools_' folder into the '_...\ComfyUI\ComfyUI\custom_nodes_' directory and restart UI, or install from ComfyUI Manager.
What is the best method to install ComfyUI_Jags_Audiotools?
The best method is to install from ComfyUI Manager and search for the name in the Node list and install from there, as it takes care of all the dependencies and installs.
Where can one find guidance on how to use ComfyUI_Jags_Audiotools?
Link to the workflow and explanations can be found in ComfyUI_Jags_Audiotools_ WIKI at https://github.com/jags111/ComfyUI_Jags_Audiotools/wiki.
What acknowledgements are made in the document?
Acknowledgements are made to: sample-diffusion, PythonGosssss, ComfyUI, Harmonai, pedalboard, xfer OTT, BlenderNeko, Chrisgoringe, pythongosssss, shiimizu, LEv145, ltdrdata.
